alert.note: Alert for South Washington Cascades (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 10 at 3:09AM PST until December 10 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST TODAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches are expected for areas above 4000 feet, and 2 to 6 inches of new snow for areas at 3000 to 4000 feet. * WHERE...South Washington Cascades. * WHEN...Until noon PST today. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow level will hover around 4000 feet this morning, the gradually lower to 3000 feet by this evening, and down to 2500 feet tonight into Sunday.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
